TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridCommandEventArgs extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the , , , , and events of the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.CancelCommand> event is raised when the Cancel button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.DeleteCommand> event is raised when the Delete button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.EditCommand> event is raised when the Edit button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.ItemCommand> event is raised when any button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked. This allows you to programmatically test for when a specific command button is clicked and take appropriate action. This event is commonly used to handle custom command buttons for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.UpdateCommand> event is raised when the Update button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to specify and code event handlers for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.EditCommand>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.CancelCommand>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.UpdateCommand> events to edit items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs> class.
When an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs> is created by a call to this constructor, the following properties are initialized to the specified values.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The value of the `commandSource` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.Item%2A>|The value of the `item` parameter.|

Docs.summary: Gets the source of the command.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to determine the command source that raised the event. This property is commonly used to determine which command raised the event.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to determine the source of the command using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the item containing the command source in the control.
Docs.value: A that represents the selected item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property is used to access the properties of the selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to retrieve the description and price of an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property.
